overview:
Tarek is a NYC based entrepreneur and current co-founder of Parrut Inc. (DBA Wakefield Media).

In 2006, Tarek co-founded MyWorkster.com, a platform for alumni to engage graduates for career opportunities. In 2008 Tarek launched MyWorkster’s events program, growing it into one of the nation’s largest and most respected job fair businesses. Tarek resigned from MyWorkster in Fall of 2011.

In 2009, Tarek launched another employment startup called Referio, a crowd sourcing hiring platform. Operations ceased in the summer of 2011 as Tarek and his Referio co-founder, Chris Johnson, went on to launch Parrut, a social marketing platform for publishers. Parrut launched it’s online digital publication, Wakefield, in spring of 2012.

In 2011, Tarek also founded Silicon Alley Labs to launch a series of tech related events for the NYC startup ecosystem. In 2012, Parrut acquired Silicon Alley Labs and its popular UNCUBED event series.

Tarek graduated the University of Virginia’s McIntire School of Commerce in 2004. Tarek lives in Brooklyn with his wife. Tarek is an avid soccer fan and co-creator of NYC Footy, a popular Brooklyn based soccer league.
